PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_SpaceHeaterTypeCommon
PropertySetDef.Definition: Space heater type common attributes.\X\0D SoundLevel attribute deleted in IFC2x2 Pset Addendum: Use IfcSoundProperties instead. Properties added in IFC4.

PropertyDef.Name: BodyMass
PropertyDef.Definition: Overall body mass of the heater.

PropertyDef.Name: EnergySource
PropertyDef.Definition: Enumeration defining the energy source or fuel combusted to generate heat if applicable. Note: hydronic heaters shall use UNSET; dual-use hydronic/electric heaters shall use ELECTRICITY.

PropertyDef.Name: HeatTransferDimension
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates how heat is transmitted according to the shape of the space heater.

PropertyDef.Name: HeatTransferMedium
PropertyDef.Definition: Enumeration defining the heat transfer medium if applicable.

PropertyDef.Name: NumberOfSections
PropertyDef.Definition: Number of vertical sections, measured in the direction of flow.

PropertyDef.Name: OutputCapacity
PropertyDef.Definition: Total nominal heat output as listed by the manufacturer.

PropertyDef.Name: PlacementType
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates how the space heater is designed to be placed.

PropertyDef.Name: Reference
PropertyDef.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1').

PropertyDef.Name: Status
PropertyDef.Definition: Status of the element, predominately used in renovation or retrofitting projects. The status can be assigned to as "New" - element designed as new addition, "Existing" - element exists and remains, "Demolish" - element existed but is to be demolished, "Temporary" - element will exists only temporary (like a temporary support structure).

PropertyDef.Name: TemperatureClassification
PropertyDef.Definition: Enumeration defining the temperature classification of the space heater surface temperature.\X\0D low temperature - surface temperature is relatively low, usually heated by hot water or electricity.\X\0D high temperature - surface temperature is relatively high, usually heated by gas or steam.

PropertyDef.Name: ThermalEfficiency
PropertyDef.Definition: Overall Thermal Efficiency is defined as gross energy output of the heat transfer device divided by the energy input.

PropertyDef.Name: ThermalMassHeatCapacity
PropertyDef.Definition: Product of component mass and specific heat.
